meta.content: COVID-19 Update www.rvaschools.net Friday, April 17, 2020 Dear #RPSStrong Family, Happy Friday! As we head into the weekend, I was reflecting on the many ways our teachers, principals, and support staff have so beautifully embodied our slogan: #TeachWithLove, #LeadWithLove, #ServeWithLove. All you need to do is read the shout-outs – which now fill 53 pages in my running Word document! – to sense how much love there is in the RPS Family. Sustaining this level of dedication to our students and families will become even more important over the coming weeks and months as people's physical and mental health suffers, the economy falters, and housing and food insecurity become even more dire. And we know this pain will not be shared equally. The inequities and injustices that existed before the coronavirus – by race, class, and more – have only become deeper and more devastating since the onset of COVID-19. div.span: While there are countless details to be worked out as we pursue this goal, there's one thing I'm certain of: now, more than ever, we must continue to teach, lead, and serve with love. In that vein, I'd like to share the final stanzas of Elizabeth Alexander's poem, "Praise Song for the Day," in which she reflects on the struggle for civil rights, and the power of love to move us towards the light.

Praise song for struggle, praise song for the day.
Praise song for every hand-lettered sign,
the figuring-it-out at kitchen tables.

love thy neighbor as thyself,
others by first do no harm or take no more
than you need.
What if the mightiest word is love?

love that casts a widening pool of light,

em.span: Many thanks to City Council President Cynthia Newbille and RPS Board Vice Chair Cheryl Burke for visiting homes to deliver Market on 25th Street groceries and for providing gift certificates!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

span.em: I will like like to personally thank Mrs. Avula from Chimborazo Elementary. She has kept in touch with the kids, including my child. She went out her way to go to each one of her former student's houses and practiced social distancing. Being a mom herself, she brought workbooks & a few school supplies from the classroom. She also keeps in touch with her students via email & via video chat. She has been the best teacher throughout the year overall & deserves all the blessings that come her way. Thank you, Ms. Avula, for your hard work & dedication from Team 109. We love you!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

span.em: I would love to give a shoutout to the awesome team at John Marshall. They have worked together in such a beautiful way to make sure technology distribution is a success. A special shoutout to Mrs. Murray and the administration team, Mrs. Battle and the counseling team, and all the staff and volunteers who have gone above and beyond. It has been a pleasure working with them for both distributions.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

span.em: I want to recognize Willis Weber, who has been doing an amazing job of coordinating the Volunteer Site Leads at the 10 school-based food distribution sites on behalf of the For Richmond network of churches. Willis was the Volunteer Site Lead at Armstrong for the first 2 weeks of this effort and then stepped up to serve as the Coordinator of all 10 sites. This week alone, he visited all 10 sites to check in with volunteers, distributed 65 washable masks to volunteers, and coordinated the donation of 150 N95 masks for bus drivers and nutrition staff!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

span.em: I would like to give a SHOUT OUT to Mrs. Valenza, Communities in Schools coordinator at Oak Grove-Bellemeade Elementary School, for continuing to check on students and their families' needs during this school closure. Thank you, Mrs. V., for always going above and beyond.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

span.em: I would like to give a SHOUT OUT to our Oak Grove-Bellemeade Elementary social media team members, Mrs. Christian, Ms. Gallo, Ms. B. Brown, Ms. K. Brown, Mrs. Valenza, Ms. Resnick, and Dr. Hooks, for consistently engaging our families using various virtual learning and communication platforms, including RPS@Home, Class Dojo, Instagram, YouTube, Twitter, Facebook, and our our school's website. We appreciate your efforts.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

span.em: I would love to thank my daughter's Earth Science and Algebra I teacher, Ms. Kathy Paschall. Ms. Paschall answers any emails and Remind messages in a timely manner and has thoroughly helped my daughter since the closure. Also, shout-out the remainder of the Franklin Military Staff, as I have received numerous check-in texts/calls and updates. FMA is the ABSOLUTE best.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

span.em: I’d like to shout out Angela Jones for her tireless leadership, and for keeping all of us informed as things develop. Thank you for keeping us engaged with so many different webinars, online courses, and articles relevant to the work we do. We appreciate you!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

span.em: I would like to thank Ms. Finney at Elkhardt-Thompson for all of the phone calls and for helping me find different learning websites to help my daughter.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

span.em: I would like to shout out Mr. George Powell, my daughter’s Honors Biology teacher at Huguenot High School. He has always been receptive and truly wants what is best for his students. We are so fortunate that she had such a good experience her first year of high school. We appreciate all he has done and continues to do for his students!!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

span.em: A big THANK YOU to Ms. Dabreona Brown, kindergarten teacher at Linwood Holton Elementary, for leading thoughtful weekly Zoom class meetings and individual video calls with students. The whole kindergarten team has come together to provide a GoogleDrive of resources for the parents. Thanks to her efforts the kids have managed to stay in touch with their classmates and continue learning.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

em.span: I would like to shout out the central admin leadership team – Harry Hughes, Tracy Epp, Shadae Harris, and Michelle Hudacsko – for conquering something none of us have ever encountered before. I’m sure each passing moment brings a new stressor and a new chance to adapt - but from the outside it feels managed and in control, when so many other things in the world do not. Thank you all for your leadership; it is not going unnoticed and we appreciate you.
